newsitem.title: CANADA: CanOxy acquires Indonesia oil interests.
newsitem.headline: CanOxy acquires Indonesia oil interests.

text.p: Canadian Occidental Petroleum Ltd said on Thursday it acquired interests in two oil exploration blocks in the Tarakan Basin off the northeast coast of Kalimantan in Indonesia.
CanOxy said it acquired a 47.5 percent interest in a production sharing contract governing oil and gas operations in the 240,000-acre Karang Besar Block.
It also gained a 10 percent stake in the adjacent 1.66 million acre Maratua Block, it said.
The blocks are operated by Maersk Oil Indonesia, a subsidiary of A.P. Moller Group of Denmark.
CanOxy said it would participate in one exploration well, Gosungan-1, on the Karang Besar Block in 1997.
The company said the "lightly explored" blocks near the onshore Tarakan and Bunyu oil fields would provide it with exposure to prospects with potentially large oil reserves.
